721009f-b.text:
Lexington Avenue, north from E. 46th Street (intersection in foreground ), showing north of 47th Street the new hotel zone with its Lexington, Shelton, Montclair and Beverly on the east side of sare. The lower block (46th - 47th Street ) front in conjunction with adjoining buildigs will be cleared (with the excention of a 20 foot parcel at No. 493) and the space improved with a 1 atory commercial buildinm to contain 11 stores, and an automobile parking lot. This will cost ~150,000. A fuller account was carried in the New York Sun of December 19, 1938. View No. 3 shows only this limited area. Note in No. 1, the
Grand Central Valace oprosite same.
March 28, 1938.
View 2: July 24, 19E2
View 3: May 21, 1928.
P.L. Sperr

721007f.text:
Lexington Avenue, north from E. 46th Street, as photoEraphed from the Graybar Building (No. 420 Lexington Avenue) showing this locale and the unfinished Waldorf-Astoria hotel.
1931
Ewing Galloway

713249f.text:
A rear view of 131 East 46th Street, adjoining the N. E. corner
of Lexington Avenue.
January 8, 1915
Wurts Brother, Photographers
